Text.Language: He said, â€œLand, land hear the word of the Lord.â€? The prophet was not speaking to the land but to the people. He ordered them to listen to the word of God uttered on his tongue. He said, â€œWrite you this man an outcastâ€? By â€œthis manâ€? he meant the kings of the Israelites and although he is speaking about one â€œmanâ€? his words apply to all. By describing the men as â€œoutcasts,â€? he indicates that they sinned against the Lord and that the prophets have testified against them. He said, â€œfor there shall none of his seed at all grow up to sit on the throne of David or as a prince yet in Judah,â€? meaning that after the coming of Jesus Christ, none of the descendants of the Israelite kings became a king.

He said, â€œWoe to the shepherds that destroy and scatter the sheep of their pasture!â€? By shepherds, he meant the priests and the teachers of the Israelites. Because they were spiteful of Jesus Christ, they prevented the people from believing in Him and they asked the people whether they had seen any of the priests or the scribes believing in Him. They added that only those who do not know the book believe in Him. Those who did not listen to them, they expelled from the Synagogue, damning their souls and the souls of their people.

He said, â€œTherefore thus says the Lord against them that tend my people; You have scattered My sheep, and driven them out, and you have not visited them.â€? He meant that God would take revenge upon the leaders of the Israelites who spoiled the hearts of their flocks and ordered them to do unrighteous things until the devil was able to capture and scatter them, meanwhile they did not want to go retrieve them and restore them to God.

He said, â€œbehold I will take vengeance upon you according to your evil practices.â€? God will punish them for their sins and the sins of their people because they did not follow the divine teachings. He said, â€œAnd I will gather in the remnant of my people in every land, whither I have driven them out, and will set them in their pasture; and they shall increase and be multiplied,â€? which means that when Jesus came, He gathered all the nations who were scattered in the world and they became His people. For He said, â€œOther sheep I have which are not of this fold them also I must bring and they will hear My voice and there will be one flock and on shepherdâ€?.

He said, â€œAnd I will raise up shepherds to them, who shall feed them.â€? By â€œthe shepherds,â€? He meant the Apostles and their successors whom He appointed shepherds of the believers. He said, â€œAnd they shall fear no more, nor be alarmed says the Lord,â€? because their shepherds are watching over them therefore they are not afraid of being stolen by the wolf of sin: Satan.

He said, â€œBehold the days come, says the Lord that I will perform that good thing which I have promised to the house of Israel and to the house of Judahâ€? By this, He meant the Incarnation of the Word of God from the house of Judah. He said, â€œI have promisedâ€? referring to Godâ€™s promise to David the prophet.â€?

He said, â€œwhen I will raise up to David a righteous branch,â€? This is our Lord Jesus Christ who is the sun of righteousness and who is Davidâ€™s descendant.

He said, â€œand a king shall reign and understand, and shall execute judgment and righteousness on the earth. In his days both Judah shall be saved and Israel shall dwell securely,â€? meaning that those who believe in Jesus Christ from the Israelites will be saved from their sins and will dwell in paradise with their father Abraham. They will feel secure when exiting this world purified from their sins and to our Lord be the Glory forever. Amen.
